intro: Rinorea beniensis, commonly known as the Beni rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
